description: On March 26, the Central African Republic has enforced the closure of extracurricular schools and universities from March 26 until the next order. description: On May 20, 2021 Prime Minister Firmin Ngrebada and the Minister of Health, Dr. Pierre Somse, officially launched the national vaccination campaign against Covid-19. Using AstraZeneca, The campaign will initially target 60,000 people, especially frontline health workers and elderly people with chronic diseases.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
type_vac_cat: Oxford University and AstraZeneca vaccine (AZD1222; also known as the Jenner Institute/University of Oxford vaccine, ChAdOx1)
type_vac_mix: This distribution policy is not about mixing and matching of different vaccines.
type_vac_group: Certain populations based on demographic characteristics/epidemiological risk given preference for vaccinations
type_vac_who_pays: No information provided on how much vaccine cost to the individual
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Priority Group 1: Essential medical workers,People with certain health conditions

description: On May 10, 2020, the government of CAR declared that all foreigners are denied entry in the country, except for diplomats, NGOs workers, and people coming from countries with no local transmission of COVID-19.

description: On May 25, 2020, the Central African Republic promulgated an external border restriction that disallows foreigners to enter the CAR, unless they come from a country with no local coronavirus transmission, or they are a diplomat or NGO worker.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: On June 26, 2020 the Central African Republic strengthened an external border restriction by banning entry to foreigners coming from countries with no local coronavirus transmission. Previously foreigners coming from countries with local transmission were allowed, pursuant to a restriction promulgated on May 27, 2020. Exemptions to the restriction for CAR citizens, diplomats, and NGO workers remain in place.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: On 17 April 2020 the National Biology Laboratory of Bangui accepted a  COVID-19 screening device from the MINUSCA Rwanda Contingent, which will help ramp up the CAR Ministry of Health’s efforts to identify infected people in order to stop the spread of the virus and save lives.

description: The Central African Republic (CAR) has received 10,000 protective masks, airlifted by Plan International to support the war-torn country in combating COVID-19.The aid cargo was sent on a humanitarian flight organised by a group of NGOs, including Plan International, with support from the European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations department (ECHO).The plane left Lyon for Bangui this morning on the 8th of May, carrying PPE and medical supplies contributed by 13 international aid agencies.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
